channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Feint Gloucester/Gloucestershire signs M5 N&S, 16th September
item.description:
The 3/4 Gloucester and Welcome to Gloucestershire signs are all very sun/UV damaged and difficult to read and need replacing. Rather than an exact like-for-like replacement, some other counties have taken the opp to showcase their county… Robin Hood Country. Leicestershire Fox. So it would be a nice opp for some improved Glos branding - I’m sure your marketing people are better than me, but e.g Gateway to the Cotswolds and the Forest of Dean?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Shortly after the houses on hyde lane a previous repair has failed causing a pothole and also a raised area of tarmac. Very dangerous for cyclists

item.description:

item.title: Around drain, 16th September
item.description:
The drain by the lights has failed again and sunk. There are several holes around it. This happens a few weeks after each repair
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princess Elizabeth Way, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken manhole, 16th September
item.description:
The manhole has sunk beneath the level of the road. The outer drain is level but the actual cover has sunk.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 172, Arle Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old tree stump and sunken hole around it on pavement, 16th September
item.description:
Problem exists at start of Lyfield road east and copt-elm road junction. On both sides of pavement, old tree stumps remain and soil has sunken leaving the stump protruding as a trip hazard. Please could these be removed and filled in to flatten the pavement out. These are on either side of the road near the railings and a lowered curb where children are crossing the road to access a local school.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Lyefield Road East, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Low hanging branches on trees which are at face level and branches sprouting out of the base of many trees on arle road which is restricting a view of traffic movement when trying to ge off driveways along the road both ways. it needs sorting ASAP before a child on their way to school is killed or injured.P, 15th September
item.description:
At many locations along Arle road between netherwood gardens and Princess Elizabeth Way on both sides of the road and also inside Brooklyn gardens.Surely it cannot take long to prune a couple of branches to inprove safety on a busy road. This issue has been going on for many months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 159, Arle Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: Pedestrian crossing, 15th September
item.description:
Pressing the crossing (Cheltenham road to nine elms junction)for lights as not working at all and lights simply allow cars to pass at the junction. This is such a busy junction for pedestrians and in rush hour today it was a nightmare for people to try and cross
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crossing not working, 15th September
item.description:
I have pressed the button for the pedestrian crossing on college road next to Sandford Park and although the wait lights up, it turns off again. The traffic lights remain green. I tried a number of times and waiting 10 minutes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): College Road, Fairview, Cheltenham

item.title: TMC - Defects - Other FW6 Surface problem, 15th September
